docs.lead_paragraph: When her husband lost his job and the bank began foreclosing on their house, Cathy Yoder turned her coupon habit into a growing business.

headline.seo: Coupon Clipping as the Key to Economic Rebirth
headline.main: Honey, I Got a Year’s Worth of Tuna Fish
headline.print_headline: Honey, I Got a Year’s Worth Of Tuna Fish

docs.abstract: Amanda Fortini article on Idaho native Cathy Yoder, who turned her coupon-clipping habit into a growing business; Yoder and her business partner Monica Knight manage the Web site Fabulessly Frugal, and are part of a growing community of people for whom coupons are a significant part of making ends meet.
docs.snippet: When her husband lost his job and the bank began foreclosing on their house, Cathy Yoder turned her coupon habit into a growing business.

docs.lead_paragraph: The fig may lack the pizazz of, say, the pomegranate for health-conscious consumers, and Nabisco’s campaign aims to shift the image of Newtons.

headline.seo: The Newtons Cookie Goes Beyond the Fig
headline.main: Reminders That a Cookie Goes Beyond the Fig
headline.print_headline: Reminders That a Cookie Goes Beyond the Fig

docs.abstract: Andrew Adam Newman Advertising column highlights Kraft Foods' campaign for its Newtons' cookies and new fruit flavors.
docs.snippet: The fig may lack the pizazz of, say, the pomegranate for health-conscious consumers, and Nabisco’s campaign aims to shift the image of Newtons.
